author: Kiiranaux
title: Amazing Set
review:
I buy every exo-force set twice for the purpose of collection the main and combo models, but this one rocked my world. It had PLENTY of cool designs, and you can arrange the gate to fit in the space you have. 
Pros:
Outer walls-great
Many figs, including sensai
cool details like sickbay
lots of room in center for battle machines
battle machine repair center

Cons:
Outer walls a little flimsy
robot battle machine (rebel front) shaky

All in all, a great set! Worth you $100

title: This is huge!
review: This is a great set and all but first, before you think about buying this set, find a place where you would put this when you are done building this for display or play. It takes up about a yard of space in length and 2 feet in width. After I built it I had to carry it up stairs on a poster board and it was a pain! OK,now to the good part. Thi set can be good for exo-force and for any other battle set, like starwars, or western because it is like a fort. So I'd buy this set If I was bored!

author: Shepp
title: Planning on getting a second
review:
As the title says, I'm planning on getting a second one. Like other reviewers have said, the build seems a bit unsatisfying and flimsy. But then again, there's so much room for improvement.

The "fences" are really lacking, the rear of the mech bays are completely open, as if the base were meant to be backed up against an actual "mountain"

With two of these sets (and two Gate Assault sets and the Golden Tower set) I plan to combine them and make an even better compound with four towers, a second mech bay, extended/reinforced fences, two large gates, two small gates, etc. Mostly by rearranging the default configuration of each set's standard builds.

Also, of all the sets that include Mecha-One, this is the only one that I found that contained his legs. This may or may not be a widespread thing.

Silent Strike is awesome, Hikaru's equivalent of Takeshi's Supernova, but in blue.

Mecha-One's mech, though interesting, looks half built. Almost as if the designers just ran out of parts.

If you can get it on sale, go for it. Don't shell out top dollar for it though.
